skill.name: grafana-dashboards
skill.description: Create and manage production Grafana dashboards for real-time visualization of system and application metrics. Use when building monitoring dashboards, visualizing metrics, or creating operational observability interfaces.
skill.summary: Create and manage production Grafana dashboards for real-time visualization of system and applicatio...
skill.author: wshobson

security_audit.summary: This skill contains only documentation and JSON dashboard examples. No executable code, scripts, file access, network activity, or command execution is present. The content is purely instructional guidance for Grafana dashboard design. The static findings of cryptographic algorithms, backtick execution, and path traversal are all false positives - backticks are markdown code delimiters, path traversal patterns are PromQL regex, and no cryptographic code exists.

content.user_title: Build Grafana dashboards with proven patterns
content.value_statement: Unstructured dashboards create noise and slow down incident response. This skill provides clear layouts, panel examples, and alert patterns for building effective monitoring dashboards that teams can act on immediately.
actual_capabilities: Explain layout hierarchy using the RED and USE methods for service and resource monitoring
Provide JSON examples for stat panels, time series graphs, tables, and heatmaps
Define query variables and demonstrate PromQL usage with variable substitution
Show alert configuration patterns embedded in dashboard JSON
Provide provisioning snippets for dashboards.yml, Terraform, and Ansible
limitations: Does not deploy Grafana instances or configure data sources
Does not validate PromQL queries against your actual metrics
Does not generate full dashboard JSON from live metric inspection
Does not configure Grafana notification channels or contact points

use_cases.title: Service health overview
use_cases.description: Design an API monitoring dashboard with request rate, error rate, and latency panels

use_cases.title: Infrastructure visibility
use_cases.description: Create node and namespace dashboards for CPU, memory, disk, and network trends

use_cases.title: Business KPI tracking
use_cases.description: Build dashboards that correlate request volume with conversion and business metrics

prompt_templates.title: Starter layout
prompt_templates.scenario: First Grafana dashboard for an API
prompt_templates.prompt: Propose a simple dashboard layout for an API with request rate, error rate, and P95 latency panels

prompt_templates.title: Add variables
prompt_templates.prompt: Add Grafana query variables for namespace and service and show how to use them in PromQL queries

prompt_templates.title: Alert pattern
prompt_templates.prompt: Define a Grafana alert for error rate above 5 percent over five minutes, including evaluator and query parameters

prompt_templates.title: Provisioning plan
prompt_templates.prompt: Outline a provisioning approach using dashboards.yml and Terraform for a production Grafana folder

output_examples.input: Design an API monitoring dashboard for a production service
output: Layout hierarchy with top critical metrics, middle trends, and bottom detailed tables
Panels for request rate per second, error rate percentage, and P95 latency
Grafana variables for namespace and service to filter all panels dynamically
Alert configuration triggering when error rate exceeds 5 percent over 5 minutes

output_examples.input: Create an infrastructure dashboard for Kubernetes clusters
output: Node-level CPU and memory utilization time series
Pod count and status by namespace
Disk I/O and network traffic by interface

best_practices: Start with a clear hierarchy from critical metrics to detailed analysis
Use consistent naming conventions and units across all panels
Test dashboards across multiple time ranges before production deployment
anti_patterns: Mixing unrelated metrics on a single panel
Using hardcoded labels instead of query variables
Setting alert thresholds without historical context or business alignment

faq.question: Is this compatible with Grafana and Prometheus?
faq.answer: Yes. Examples use Grafana dashboard JSON format and PromQL for Prometheus data sources.

faq.question: Are there limits on dashboard size?
faq.answer: The skill sets no limits. Grafana performance depends on query load and panel count.

faq.question: Can it integrate with Terraform or Ansible?
faq.answer: Yes. It includes example snippets for Terraform dashboard resources and Ansible copy tasks.

faq.question: Does it access my data or credentials?
faq.answer: No. The skill is pure documentation and does not read files or make network calls.

faq.question: My metric names differ from examples. What should I do?
faq.answer: Replace metric names and labels to match your environment and validate in Grafana Explore.

faq.question: How is this different from community dashboards?
faq.answer: It focuses on reusable design principles so you can build custom dashboards from scratch.
